noun.description: A short rod of wood or plastic sewn to one side of a coat or other garment, pushed through a hole or loop on the other side and twisted so as to act as a fastener.
A key or command that toggles between two modes, such as the caps lock key.

verb.description: Switch from one effect, feature, or state to another by using a toggle.
examples: the play/pause button toggles between those functions
there are a number of attributes which can be toggled on or off

verb.description: Provide or fasten with a toggle or toggles.
examples: our horses were hobbled or toggled before they were turned out to graze

origin: Mid 18th century (originally in nautical use): of unknown origin.
